content: I've been doing perf triage for 10 weeks now, long enough that I feel like the process is relatively settled. I'd be happy to have assistance, if anybody would like to help. It usually takes me about 45 minutes, in a normal week without too many regressions. (Two weeks ago it was 2 hours or more, but that was an unusually bad week.)
It makes sense for one person to do the report for each week, so perhaps we could alternate weeks.
@Santiago Pastorino is this of interest to you?
I would be interested in doing this
Maybe I can do it next tuesday as well, and we can compare results or so? That way it's less difference or so
Sure, how about you do it "properly", and I'll do a rough version where I don't paste in all the comments carefully :)
You'll have to do put the comments into the PRs, containing the links to the results from landing
I’m interested too and maybe others from @WG-prioritization are as well
but I really like the idea of alternating it as a way to collectively own the task
I think we should also try do the same with the compiler meeting agenda which I usually build
it’s better and safer if others also know how to do it
let's start with just two of us I think, alternating weeks I guess, and then we can maybe hand off to others
I will take the prioritization discussion part to the prioritization stream :blush:
